text.text: Kyle grew up in Ohio and then spent his 20s in the Army as a helicopter mechanic. He was inspired to get into trail running after reading Born to Run, and in 2012 ran his first trail race. Since that first race almost ten years ago, ultramarathons, mountains, and the trails around them have been a constant in his life. After finishing an Army contract in 2015, Kyle moved out to Durango, Colorado to get his degree in Exercise Science and explore the San Juan mountains. He lives and work in SW Colorado where he likes to train for long-distance races and take his dog to mountain tops.

image.alt: Black and white icon of a trophy

text_copy.text:
Accomplishments:
  • 2021 Tor des Geants top American 11th OA 330km
  • 2021 M9 at Western States Endurance Run 100 miles
  • 2020 Pitchell (Asheville NC) Fastest Known Time 62 miles
  • 2020 FKT unsupported on the Tahoe Rim Trail 171 miles
  • 2018 Tahoe 200 miler win and course record
  • 2017 Colorado Trail thru hike
  • 2016 Run Rabbit Run 100 podium
  • 2015 AT thru hike
  • 2014 Kettle Moraine 100 win
  • 2014 Ozark 100 mile win and course record

image.alt: Black and white icon of a stopwatch

text.text:
How fast do you think you could run a backwards mile?
13:33 and it would be awkward and difficult.

image.alt: Black and white icon of a heart

text.text:
What is one of your most memorable non-competition runs?

Not a run, but when I finished my Army enlistment,  my dad also retired and we hiked the Appalachian Trail from Georgia to Maine.

image.alt: Black and white icon of a flag

text_606144095.text:
If you had to pick one race or event this year that you anticipate will be your most proud achievement or moment, which one would it be and why? Do you have a special connection?

TBD

image.alt: Black and white icon of a star representing a day on a calendar

text.text:
What is your favorite event to watch that you dont participate in?

I grew up watching the St. Louis Cardinals,  and baseball games are a great time to do strength work, eat, or nap!

image.alt: Black and white icon of a running shoe

text.text:
Do you have any quirky running habits?

I only run on days that end in "y".

text_1679951928.text:
Eat a slice of pizza mid-race or drink a milkshake?

Pizza.  In fact,  I've done that!

text.text:
Run on an empty stomach or a full bladder? 

Empty stomach doesn't both me at all.

text_1679951928.text:
Do a beer mile or a milk mile?

Beer.  Cows and running don't mix.

Run in the freezing cold or the sweltering heat?

Western States was well into the 100s this summer, and that went went, so heat!

text_1679951928_copy.text:
Be met at the finish line with your favorite beverage or favorite meal?

Meal.  That must mean I've just ran a really long way.

Come across a snake or a rat on your run?

I don't think I've ever seen a rat on a run. That could be fun. Well, more fun than a snake!

Run with a blister on your foot or a cramp in your side?

I don't get blisters, even in the 200 milers. And I don't envy the people who do!

Give up core work or stretching and still stay injury-free?

I love strength work, and I don't stretch. So I'll just keep on keeping on, injury free.

Run uphill in the first half of your run or the second?

Up first and then down is big mountain running, my favorite!
